snippet: The 14 Chinese, who include journalists, planted Chinese flags on one of a group of islands controlled by Japan but also claimed by China and Taiwan.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO -- China pressed Japan on Thursday to release 14 Chinese citizens arrested after some of them arrived on an island claimed by both countries, amid signs that Tokyo may soon deport them without pressing charges to avert a larger standoff.The 14 Chinese, who include protesters and journalists, had traveled by boat from Hong Kong to a group of uninhabited islands controlled by Japan but also claimed by China and Taiwan . They were arrested on Wednesday after seven of them arrived on the largest of the islands, called the Senkakus by Japan and Diaoyu by China.

headline.main: China Urges Japan to Release Protesters Caught on Disputed Island
